tly sound. Given that no fetus pos-
sesses the right to life, a woman’s right to control her own body easily gen-
erates  the  general  right  to  abortion.  The  existence  of  two  apparently
defensible syllogisms which support contrary conclusions helps to explain
why partisans on both sides of the abortion dispute often regard their oppo-
nents as either morally depraved or mentally deficient.
Which syllogism should we reject? The anti-abortion syllogism is usually
attacked by attacking its
